venue.name: The Fred Lippitt Woonasquatucket River Greenway

item.description:
If it is raining – I will reschedule for another day.

PLEASE TAKE THE POLL TO LET US KNOW WHAT YOU ARE GOING TO DO...
WALK, JOG, RUN, BIKE or ROLL. Click the link below to vote
http://www.meetup.com...

My meetups are just for fun and pleasure.
Anyone and everyone is welcome.
So don't get stressed about having to complete the whole path, just come on out, enjoy the outdoors and meet some new folks.

The Fred Lippitt Woonasquatucket River Bikeway: 5.1 miles between Providence Place Mall and Lyman Ave. in Johnston.
A bicycle/pedestrian path links recreational areas, green spaces, destination sites, and the neighborhoods of Manton, Hartford, Olneyville, Valley, and Smith Hill to each other and Waterplace Park in downtown Providence.

Go at your own pace
Go as far as you want
Stop where ever you want
Stay for as long as you want & leave whenever you want.
NO STRESS!!!

Parking for the Fred Lippitt Woonasquatucket River Greenway is available:

* Hedley Ave. in Johnston - abutting the bike path. From I-295 North take Exit 6A (Route 6 EAST) or via I-295 South take Exit 6 (Route 6 EAST) to Rte. 128 Killingly St. exit - follow Killingly St. to intersection with Greenville Ave. Turn right onto Greenville Ave - approximately 1/4 mile turn right onto Hedley Ave. Parking area is on your left.

If it is raining – I will reschedule for another day.

I drive a white Toyota Highland meet me by my car. We won't leave until 10 AM
item.how_to_find_us: I have a White Toyota SVU. I will have a Red Towel unfold over the hood
item.name: Woonasquatucket River Path - 5 Miles Long - 10 Miles Total Trip Back & Forth
